javadoc: An abstract class containing static utility methods for creating structure data types.

methods.name: is64Bit
methods.comment: Determines if the indicated program appears to be 64 bit (has 64 bit pointers).

params.name: program
params.comment: the program

methods.name: getAlignedPack8Structure
methods.comment:
Gets an empty aligned structure with a packing value of 8 that can be use to create the 
 model's data type.

params.name: dataTypeManager
params.comment: the data type manager to associate with the structure.

params.name: categoryPath
params.comment: the structure's category path.

params.name: structureName
params.comment: the structure's name.

methods.name: getAlignedPack4Structure
methods.comment:
Gets an empty aligned structure with a packing value of 4 that can be use to create the 
 model's data type.

params.name: dataTypeManager
params.comment: the data type manager to associate with the structure.

params.name: categoryPath
params.comment: the structure's category path.

params.name: structureName
params.comment: the structure's name.

methods.name: getAlignedPackedStructure
methods.comment:
Gets an empty aligned structure with the indicated packing value that can be use to create the 
 model's data type.

params.name: dataTypeManager
params.comment: the data type manager to associate with the structure.

params.name: categoryPath
params.comment: the structure's category path.

params.name: structureName
params.comment: the structure's name.

params.name: packValue
params.comment: the packing value or 0 NOT_PACKING

methods.name: getEHStateDataType
methods.comment: Gets an exception handling state data type.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program for the data type.

return.comment: the exception handling state data type.

methods.name: getPointerDisplacementDataType
methods.comment: Gets a pointer displacement data type.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program for the data type.

methods.name: getPMDDataType
methods.comment: Gets a PMD displacement structure data type.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program for the data type.

return.comment: the PMD data type or null.

methods.name: getMatchingDataType
methods.comment:
Gets the named data type from the program or the windows data type archive. If neither 
 the program or data type archive has an equivalent data type then the original data type 
 is returned.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program for the data type.

params.name: comparisonDt
params.comment: the data type it should match

methods.name: getAbsoluteAddress
methods.comment: Extracts an absolute address from the bytes in memory at the indicated address in memory.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program containing the bytes

params.name: address
params.comment: the address in memory where the address bytes should be obtained.

return.comment: the absolute address or null if the address isn't in the program's memory.

methods.name: getReferencedAddress
methods.comment:
Gets the referred to address from the bytes in the program at the indicated address.
 If the program has 64 bit pointers, then a 32 bit image base offset value is expected to 
 be found at the indicated address. 
 If the program has 32 bit pointers, then a 32 bit absolute pointer value is expected at the
 indicated address.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program whose memory is to be read.

params.name: address
params.comment: the address to start reading the bytes for the referenced address.

return.comment: the referred to address or null.

methods.name: getBytes
methods.comment:
Gets bytes from memory at the indicated startAddress. 
 The length indicates the number of bytes that must be read 
 from memory.

params.name: memory
params.comment: the program memory for obtaining the bytes

params.name: startAddress
params.comment: the address to begin reading bytes

params.name: length
params.comment: the number of bytes to read

throws.comment:
if the length number of bytes couldn't 
 be read starting at the startAddress in memory.

methods.name: getReferenceDataType
methods.comment:
Gets the appropriate reference data type. If program is 64 bit, then a 32-bit image 
 base offset data type will be returned. Otherwise, a default pointer to the 
 referredToDataType will be returned.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program that will contain the returned data type

params.name: referredToDataType
params.comment:
the data type that is at the address being referred to by the 
 pointer or image base offset. Otherwise, null.

return.comment: the image base offset or pointer reference data type

name: MSDataTypeUtils
comment: An abstract class containing static utility methods for creating structure data types.
